Basic details: Michael Green, a 52-year-old male, comes to the ED complaining of chest pain.
Vitals:
BP: 150/95 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 20/minute
HR: 88/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sitting on the edge of the bed, holding his chest with a pained expression.
Breathing slightly labored.
Occasionally glancing at the monitor, appearing anxious.
If asked about the pain, he states it feels like pressure and radiates to his left arm.
Challenging question: "Could this be something serious? What should I do next?"
